intro: Cyrtandra kohalae, commonly known as the Kohala mountain heliotrope, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to the moist, shaded environments of the high-elevation forests on the Kohala Mountain. It has small, heart-shaped leaves and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Cyrtandra kohalae is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
